quote: Stories You Can Feel!
author: Corey Aaron Burkes,  Scratch - with Audio Theater and Links

quote: Don't be satisfied with stories, how things have gone with others. Unfold your own myth.
author: Rumi,  The Essential Rumi

quote: Suddenly I remembered that laugh, it told a different story, our story.
author: Robert M. Drake

quote: Some of these things are true and some of them lies. But they are all good stories.
author: Hilary Mantel,  Wolf Hall

quote: I just knew there were stories I wanted to tell.
author: Octavia E. Butler

quote: Stories change us; they change the world. People are stories of themselves.
author: Karen Healey,  Guardian of the Dead

quote: The truth of the story lies in the details.
author: Paul Auster,  The Brooklyn Follies

quote: You know my name, not my story. You've heard what I've done, but not what I've been through.
author: Jonathan Anthony Burkett,  Neglected But Undefeated

quote: Someone has to write all those stories: why not me?
author: Elizabeth Gilbert

quote: No guts, no story.
author: Chris Brady

quote: My story was not the story of a girl's broken dreams: it was the story of a girl who couldn't be broken.
author: Heather Schuck,  The Working Mom Manifesto

quote: The story is always better than your ability to write it.
author: Robin McKinley

quote: Stories make us more alive, more human, more courageous, more loving.
author: Madeleine L'Engle

quote: If you don't like someone's story, write your own.
author: Chinua Achebe

quote: If a story is in you, it has to come out.
author: William Faulkner

quote: The true story of every person in this world is not the story you see, the external story. The true story of each person is the journey of his or her heart.
author: John Eldredge,  The Sacred Romance: Drawing Closer to the Heart of God

quote: To survive, you must tell stories.
author: Umberto Eco,  The Island of the Day Before

quote: A story to me means a plot where there is some surprise. Because that is how life is - full of surprises.
author: Isaac Bashevis Singer

quote: A story is a letter that the author writes to himself, to tell himself things that he would be unable to discover otherwise.
author: Carlos Ruiz Zafón,  The Shadow of the Wind

quote: A good story is always more dazzling than a broken piece of truth.
author: Diane Setterfield,  The Thirteenth Tale

quote: But how could you live and have no story to tell?
author: Fyodor Dostoyevsky,  White Nights

quote: Stories are psycho-diagnostic ― they diagnose the condition of our psyches. When we watch, read or hear a story, whatever detail jumps out reflects an issue in our psyche that requires our attention.
author: Thea Euryphaessa,  Running Into Myself

quote: I wrote the story myself. It's about a girl who lost her reputation and never missed it.
author: Mae West

quote: The real problem with stories - if you keep them going long enough, they always end in death.
author: Neil Gaiman,  The Sandman, Vol. 1: Preludes and Nocturnes

quote: We owe it to each other to tell stories.
author: Neil Gaiman

quote: We are surrounded by story.
author: Alice McDermott

quote: Stories may well be lies, but they are good lies that say true things, and which can sometimes pay the rent.
author: Neil Gaiman

quote: Why write stories? To join the conversation.
author: Dorothy Allison,  Trash: Stories

quote: Women want love to be a novel. Men, a short story.
author: Daphne du Maurier

quote: Somebody gets into trouble, then gets out of it again. People love that story. They never get tired of it.
author: Kurt Vonnegut

quote: Women want love to be a novel, men a short story.
author: Daphne du Maurier

quote: I will not tell you our love story, because-like all real love stories-it will die with us,as it should.
author: John Green,  The Fault in Our Stars

quote: Stories can conquer fear, you know. They can make the heart bigger.
author: Ben Okri

quote: Our story has three parts: a beginning, a middle, and an end. And although this is the way all stories unfold, I still can't believe that ours didn't go on forever.
author: Nicholas Sparks,  Dear John

quote: The best stories don't come from "good vs. bad"but "good vs. good.
author: Leo Tolstoy

quote: When all the details fit in perfectly, something is probably wrong with the story.
author: Charles Baxter,  Burning Down the House: Essays on Fiction

quote: All we have is the story we tell. Everything we do, every decision we make, our strength, weakness, motivation, history, and character-what we believe-none of it is real; it's all part of the story we tell. But here's the thing: it's our goddamned story!
author: Jess Walter,  Beautiful Ruins

quote: A short story is a different thing all together - a short story is like a kiss in the dark from a stranger.
author: Stephen King,  Skeleton Crew

quote: My circumstances of unrelieved responsibility and permanent distraction necessitated the short story form.
author: Raymond Carver

quote: On the whole, stories don't write themselves.
author: Neil Gaiman,  Fragile Things: Short Fictions and Wonders

quote: ...I told him a story of two people. Two people who shouldn't have met, and who didn't like each other much when they did, but who found they were the only two people in the world who could possibly have understood each other.
author: Jojo Moyes,  Me Before You

quote: A good story cannot be devised; it has to be distilled.
author: Raymond Chandler

quote: If the story you're telling, is the story you're telling, you're in deep shit.
author: Robert McKee,  Story: Style, Structure, Substance, and the Principles of Screenwriting

quote: As long as we don't die, this is gonna be one hell of a story.
author: John Green,  Paper Towns

quote: Good ideas stay with you until you eventually write the story.
author: Brian Keene

quote: A lie was something you told because you were mean or a coward. A story was something you made up out of something that might have happened. Only you didn't tell it like it was, you told it like you thought it should have been.
author: Betty Smith,  A Tree Grows in Brooklyn

quote: You’re just another story I can’t tell anymore.
author: pleasefindthis,  I Wrote This For You

quote: But the purpose of a story is to teach and to please at once, and what it teaches is how to recognize the snares of the world.
author: Umberto Eco,  The Island of the Day Before

quote: I know I was writing stories when I was five. I don't know what I did before that. Just loafed, I suppose.
author: P.G. Wodehouse

quote: Whenever I write a story, I hope it appeals to both boys and girls.
author: Suzanne Collins
